prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Will Stefan confess that he has romantic feelings for me, if so, when?

Stefan should be represented by the 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical listing of the pertinent chart data that will be used for the horary analysis of your question – “Will Stefan confess that he has romantic feelings for me, if so, when?” Remember that you represent yourself via the Ascendant, and Stefan is represented by the 9th house (with its ruler, planetary placements, and aspects) as per your cross‐reference guide.

1. Planetary Positions (by degree, sign, and house):
 • Sun at 15°32′ Pisces – located in the 8th house (house of hidden matters, transformation)
 • Moon at 5°09′ Gemini – located in the 10th house (noting public expression, reputation)
 • Mercury at 3°25′ Aries – located in the 8th house
 • Venus at 10°31′ Aries (retrograde) – located in the 9th house (Stefan’s sector)
 • Mars at 17°35′ Cancer – located in the 11th house
 • Jupiter at 12°41′ Gemini – located in the 10th house
 • Saturn at 21°17′ Pisces – located in the 8th house
 • Uranus at 23°46′ Taurus – located in the 10th house
 • Neptune at 29°04′ Pisces – located in the 8th house
 • Pluto at 3°00′ Aquarius – located in the 6th house
 • North Node at 28°06′ Pisces (retrograde) – located in the 8th house
 • Chiron at 20°51′ Aries – located in the 9th house

2. House Configuration and Relevance:
 • Ascendant (20° Leo) represents you; the interpretation of your matters begins here.
 • The 9th house (starting at 8° Aries) represents Stefan; note that it contains Venus and Chiron, pivotal for relationship matters.
 • The 8th house (starting at 13° Pisces), holding Sun, Mercury, Saturn, Neptune, and North Node, highlights issues of hidden motives, secrecy, and deeper emotional transformation that may influence the willingness or timing of confession.

3. Major Aspects (with orb indications):
 • Mercury Sextile Pluto, orb 0° – indicates deep investigative insight into hidden matters.
 • MC Opposition IC, orb 0° – a dynamic tension between public and private realms.
 • Chiron Trine Ascendant, orb 0° – suggests healing or significant emotional sensitivity in your personal presentation.
 • Neptune Conjunction North Node, orb 1° – accentuates spiritual or enigmatic influences, especially in the 8th house area.
 • Saturn Sextile Uranus, orb 2° – points to the interplay of tradition and sudden shifts; relevant in timing matters.
 • Venus Sextile Jupiter, orb 2° – a positive aspect for matters of love and expansion that could encourage acceptance of feelings.
 • Moon Sextile Mercury, orb 2° – aids communication regarding hidden emotions.
 • Moon Trine Pluto, orb 2° – reveals transformative emotional insights.
 • Sun Trine Mars, orb 2° – a dynamic yet harmonious push that can generate direct action.
 • Uranus Square Ascendant, orb 3° – introduces unexpected influences affecting your personal state.
 • Mars Square Chiron, orb 3° – signals tension between impulsive desires and wounded sensitivities (notably in Stefan’s 9th-house representation via Chiron).
 • Sun Square Jupiter, orb 3° – highlights potential over-optimism or conflict between self-expression and external expectations.
 • Sun Sextile MC, orb 4° – facilitates the expression of your intentions within public matters.
 • Mercury Conjunction Neptune, orb 4° – underscores dreaminess or idealized communication.
 • Mars Trine Saturn, orb 4° – indicates controlled energy, possibly a delayed action regarding a confession.
 • Sun Trine IC, orb 4° – supports clarity in the underlying emotional foundation.
 • Moon Sextile Venus, orb 5° – aids in the gentle expression of affection.
 • Uranus Sextile Neptune, orb 6°; Mars Sextile MC, orb 6°; Mars Sextile Uranus, orb 6° – all support dynamic yet unconventional developments.
 • Moon Sextile Neptune, orb 6° – reinforces emotional intuition.
 • Sun Conjunction Saturn, orb 6° – emphasizes seriousness and potential delays due to responsibility or caution.
 • Mars Trine IC, orb 6° – supports initiative in personal matters.
 • Venus Square Mars, orb 7° – introduces tension between desire and assertive action.
 • Mercury Conjunction Venus, orb 7° – blends communication with attraction, although with some ambiguity.
 • Moon Conjunction Jupiter, orb 7° – supercharges the emotional tone with hopes or expectations.

4. Chart Patterns and Special Features:
 • Stellium in the 8th house: Includes Neptune (29° Pisces), North Node (28° Pisces), Mercury (3° Aries), underscoring the weight given to hidden matters and transformations.
 • Grand Trine among Sun (8th house), IC (11° Scorpio), and Mars (11th house): Highlights supportive, flowing energy between underlying emotional truths and outward action.
 • Kite and Yod formations:
  – Kite: Involving Sun (8th), IC, Mars, and MC points to focused energy that can catalyze significant events (such as a confession) on a structured timeline.
  – Yod: Between IC (11° Scorpio), Jupiter (10th house) and Venus (9th house) suggests a destined or fated adjustment in the dynamic between your personal identity and Stefan’s expression.
 • Additional Observations:
  – The Moon is a waxing crescent, which in horary matters often signifies ideas in early or emerging stages.
  – The chart is described as Bowl-shaped, indicating a concentration of energy in a particular sector (notably the upper right quadrant, impacting public and transformative matters).
  – A prevalence of Sextile aspects (totaling 10) suggests abundant opportunities and supportive energies at work.
  – With Neptune in Pisces, its rulership is emphasized when positioned in its own sign, lending added weight to underlying intuitive cues.

This comprehensive list encapsulates all the available relevant horary chart data – planetary positions with housing, major aspects with orb details, chart patterns, and special features – to prepare for a data-driven interpretation aligned with traditional horary principles.

Review these notes carefully. I await your confirmation or further instructions for the interpretation phase.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
The chart shows that hidden emotions are gathering force in the 8th house, where a strong stellium (Sun, Mercury, Saturn, Neptune, and North Node) gives weight to matters kept secret. This suggests that Stefan’s feelings, though potent, are confined behind personal barriers, making a confession a matter of inner transformation.

In his 9th-house representation, Venus signifies his capacity for love while Chiron points to past wounds that may render him hesitant. The energy of Venus, supported by a favorable sextile to Jupiter, indicates that deep affection is present and that, under the right conditions, his heart may find safe expression. Still, the square between Mars and Chiron suggests that these wounds could trigger conflict or delay before he is able to express himself clearly.

The Moon in Gemini in the 10th house hints at a public or externally visible shift as emotions move from the hidden to the expressed realm. Its cordial aspects to Mercury and Venus further facilitate communication, suggesting that eventually, the underlying tension will be released into an act of confession.

A dynamic grand trine involving the Sun in Pisces, Mars in Cancer, and the IC in Scorpio indicates the convergence of transformative personal insight with an impulse to act. Additionally, the Kite configuration focusing energy between the personal (IC) and public (MC) sectors seems to concentrate an eventual breakthrough.

Saturn’s presence in the 8th house tempers the process; his conjunction with the Sun delays immediate action until a period of maturity and responsibility is reached. In practical terms, the controlled energy indicated by Mars trine Saturn denotes that Stefan’s public confession may come only after an internal realignment and healing.

Timing indicators point to the emotional surge arriving as the Moon moves toward a fuller expression of its phase. Given the Moon is a waxing crescent, Silvia’s internal responsiveness and the public influence of the Moon’s placement suggest that the confession is unlikely to occur immediately. Instead, it is more apt to unfold later in the current cycle—typically implying a delay measured in days or possibly weeks rather than hours, as personal transformation and a buildup of confidence are needed before he can overcome his vulnerabilities.

Based on these chart configurations, the indications favor a confession by Stefan. However, the final timing appears conditional on the resolution of his inner wounds and the gradual build-up toward a public expression. The supportive aspects (especially Venus sextile Jupiter and Moon connections to Mercury and Venus) foster the eventual clarity of feelings. The delays implied by Saturn’s influence and the tension of Mars with Chiron point to a confession likely manifesting when he has found a measure of control over his emotional impulses.

The precise window is not rigidly defined by a single aspect; rather, the overall portrait is that reaction—a genuine declaration of romantic feelings—will occur, but only after his internal readiness allows for a measured shift toward outward admission.

In summary, the chart data shows that Stefan’s feelings are earnest and present. The emission of his confession is delayed by personal inhibitions, yet the supportive influences indicate that as those are worked through, there will be a significant moment—likely in a matter of several days to weeks—when he finally finds the courage to speak his heart openly.
swipes:
The chart shows that hidden emotions are gathering force in the 8th house, where a strong stellium (Sun, Mercury, Saturn, Neptune, and North Node) gives weight to matters kept secret. This suggests that Stefan’s feelings, though potent, are confined behind personal barriers, making a confession a matter of inner transformation.

In his 9th-house representation, Venus signifies his capacity for love while Chiron points to past wounds that may render him hesitant. The energy of Venus, supported by a favorable sextile to Jupiter, indicates that deep affection is present and that, under the right conditions, his heart may find safe expression. Still, the square between Mars and Chiron suggests that these wounds could trigger conflict or delay before he is able to express himself clearly.

The Moon in Gemini in the 10th house hints at a public or externally visible shift as emotions move from the hidden to the expressed realm. Its cordial aspects to Mercury and Venus further facilitate communication, suggesting that eventually, the underlying tension will be released into an act of confession.

A dynamic grand trine involving the Sun in Pisces, Mars in Cancer, and the IC in Scorpio indicates the convergence of transformative personal insight with an impulse to act. Additionally, the Kite configuration focusing energy between the personal (IC) and public (MC) sectors seems to concentrate an eventual breakthrough.

Saturn’s presence in the 8th house tempers the process; his conjunction with the Sun delays immediate action until a period of maturity and responsibility is reached. In practical terms, the controlled energy indicated by Mars trine Saturn denotes that Stefan’s public confession may come only after an internal realignment and healing.

Timing indicators point to the emotional surge arriving as the Moon moves toward a fuller expression of its phase. Given the Moon is a waxing crescent, Silvia’s internal responsiveness and the public influence of the Moon’s placement suggest that the confession is unlikely to occur immediately. Instead, it is more apt to unfold later in the current cycle—typically implying a delay measured in days or possibly weeks rather than hours, as personal transformation and a buildup of confidence are needed before he can overcome his vulnerabilities.

Based on these chart configurations, the indications favor a confession by Stefan. However, the final timing appears conditional on the resolution of his inner wounds and the gradual build-up toward a public expression. The supportive aspects (especially Venus sextile Jupiter and Moon connections to Mercury and Venus) foster the eventual clarity of feelings. The delays implied by Saturn’s influence and the tension of Mars with Chiron point to a confession likely manifesting when he has found a measure of control over his emotional impulses.

The precise window is not rigidly defined by a single aspect; rather, the overall portrait is that reaction—a genuine declaration of romantic feelings—will occur, but only after his internal readiness allows for a measured shift toward outward admission.

In summary, the chart data shows that Stefan’s feelings are earnest and present. The emission of his confession is delayed by personal inhibitions, yet the supportive influences indicate that as those are worked through, there will be a significant moment—likely in a matter of several days to weeks—when he finally finds the courage to speak his heart openly.
